channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Kitchen Hob and bagged waste outside Brunswick House Balcombe Street, 10th July
item.description:
There is a continuing issue of rubbish being left out on Balcombe Street. Please carry out enforcement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 92, Balcombe Street, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Posts vandalised, 10th July
item.description:
The wooden posts on the edge of the green chain walk have been vandalised, they have been completely pulled out by the ever increasing number of kids accumulating and causing a disturbance on this stretch of green chain walk and road at the end of Wayside Grove.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wayside Grove, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Scooters - moped, 10th July
item.description:
I've noticed that in the Soho area, scooters, mopeds, and Lime bikes are often ignoring basic road safety. They're speeding through the streets, sometimes almost colliding with pedestrians crossing at junctions. There seems to be little regard for safety standards, which is particularly concerning given that this is one of the busiest parts of London.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 51, Brewer Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3 wheelie bins never put away, 10th July
item.description:
The pavement outside 21 is permanently blocked by 3 wheelie bins that are never put away. The pavement is narrow outside the house so people with buggies or dogs can't get past.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, Hill Close, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin men leaving rubbish strewn across the road after emptying bins, 10th July
item.description:
This is a regular event each Tuesday during collection. If anything large or small falls out of recycling bags as they're thrown into the van, they leave it in the road, even stepping over it and then drive off. Result: our road looks like a tip.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Colberg Place, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping of multiple bags of rubbish, 10th July
item.description:
Bags of rubbish are being left on the street. They are scattered along Lannoy Road and Gaitskell Road. I thought they may have been left by a street sweeper but some have been there over a week. I took some bags that were left outside my house to the dump a while back, but more have appeared. The longer they're left, the more rubbish is being added.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Reventlow Road, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking Restriction Sign Post Knocked - Lambton Road N19, 10th July
item.description:
The sign post displaying parking restrictions appears to have been hit and is now leaning over and unstable. Post is situated between 55 - 61 Lambton Road. Photo provided.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 55, Lambton Road, Finsbury Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet
